rdfs:label: Assertion definition language
ns:common.topic.description: The Assertion Definition Language is a specification language providing a formal grammar to specify behaviour and interfaces for computer software. ADL uses function pre- and postconditions to specify interfaces and is designed to provide an intermediary between informal English language specifications and formal programmatic test specifications. Tool support exists both to convert ADL specifications into natural language, and to generate test systems against which implementation code can be verified.\nADL is developed cooperatively by The Open Group and SunTest of Sun Microsystems.
